block.p: After 10 years in power, President Alberto Fujimori of Peru faced his most serious challenge, but after several days of uncertainty appeared to have beaten back the threat.
After 10 years in power, President Alberto Fujimori of Peru faced his most serious challenge, but after several days of uncertainty appeared to have beaten back the threat.

Mr. Fujimori announced new elections and the dissolution of the national intelligence service after a damaging bribery episode came to light. His spy chief, implicated in the scandal, dropped from sight, and opposition groups called for Mr. Fujimori's immediate resignation. On Thursday, a statement of support from the armed forces solidified his position even if it left the price extracted by the military and the fate of the intelligence boss unclear.
